ids_info.name: lh_antennas
ids_info.description: Antenna systems for heating and current drive in the Lower Hybrid (LH) frequencies. In the definitions below, the front (or mouth) of the antenna refers to the plasma facing side of the antenna, while the back refers to the waveguides connected side of the antenna (towards the RF generators).

lh_antennas/reference_point.documentation: Reference point used to define the poloidal angle, e.g. the geometrical centre of the vacuum vessel. Used to define the poloidal refraction index under antenna/row

lh_antennas/antenna/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device)

lh_antennas/antenna/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”

lh_antennas/antenna/model_name.documentation: Name of the antenna model used for antenna spectrum computation

lh_antennas/antenna/power_launched.documentation: Power launched from this antenna into the vacuum vessel

lh_antennas/antenna/power_forward.documentation: Forward power arriving at the back of the antenna

lh_antennas/antenna/reflection_coefficie.documentation: Power reflection coefficient, averaged over modules

lh_antennas/antenna/phase_average.documentation: Phase difference between two neighbouring modules (average over modules), at the mouth (front) of the antenna

lh_antennas/antenna/n_parallel_peak.documentation: Peak parallel refractive index of the launched wave spectrum (simple estimate based on the measured phase difference)

lh_antennas/antenna/position.documentation: Position of a reference point on the antenna (allowing also tracking the possible movements of the antenna)

lh_antennas/antenna/position/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above)

lh_antennas/antenna/pressure_tank.documentation: Pressure in the vacuum tank of the antenna

lh_antennas/antenna/distance_to_antenna.documentation: Radial distance to the antenna mouth (grid for the electron density profile). 0 at antenna mouth, increasing towards the plasma

lh_antennas/antenna/n_e.documentation: Electron density profile in front of the antenna

lh_antennas/antenna/module/power_launche.documentation: Power launched from this module into the vacuum vessel

lh_antennas/antenna/module/power_forward.documentation: Forward power arriving to the back of the module

lh_antennas/antenna/module/phase.documentation: Phase of the forward power arriving at the back of this module

lh_antennas/antenna/row.documentation: Set of horizontal rows of waveguides (corresponding to different poloidal positions). A power spectrum is provided for each row.

lh_antennas/antenna/row/position.documentation: Position of the middle on the row

lh_antennas/antenna/row/n_phi.documentation: Refraction index in the toroidal direction

lh_antennas/antenna/row/n_pol.documentation: Refraction index in the poloidal direction. The poloidal angle is defined from the reference point; the angle at a point (R,Z) is given by atan((Z-Zref)/(R-Rref)), where Rref=reference_point/r and Zref=reference_point/z

lh_antennas/antenna/row/power_density_sp.documentation: 1D power density spectrum dP/dn_phi, as a function of time
2D power density spectrum d2P/(dn_tor.dn_pol), as a function of time

lh_antennas/antenna/row/time.documentation: Timebase for the dynamic nodes of this probe located at this level of the IDS structure

lh_antennas/power_launched.documentation: Power launched into the vacuum vessel by the whole LH system (sum over antennas)

lh_antennas/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between input command received from the RT network and actuator starting to react. Applies globally to the system described by this IDS unless specific latencies (e.g. channel-specific or antenna-specific) are provided at a deeper level in the IDS structure.
